word: Then He tells them that they will also cooperate with the Holy Spirit. The great Source of their strength--which is our changeless consolation and hope and courage--would ever be within their reach. They were to be Christ's witnesses. "And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning" (verse 27). They should be His faithful representatives to an apostate world. While in the world they are not to be of the world, but bear a faithful testimony against the evil that is working in worldly policy plans contrary to the truth and righteousness.--Manuscript 80, May 3, 1893, "Diary."
